snippet: The future Freshkills Park on Staten Island buffered residential areas around it from the worst effects of Hurricane Sandy. Perhaps that will prompt the city to get the park ready for visitors.
abstract: Michael Kimmelman urges New York City officials to get planned Freshkills park in Staten Island ready for visitors; notes that park has not only been transformed from landfill into vast green space, but has crucially served as wetlands buffer against storm surge from Hurricane Sandy.
lead_paragraph: The future Freshkills Park on Staten Island buffered residential areas around it from the worst effects of Hurricane Sandy. Perhaps that will prompt the city to get the park ready for visitors.

headline.seo: Fresh Kills Landfill Proves Savior in Hurricane Sandy
headline.main: Former Landfill, a Park to Be, Proves a Savior in the Hurricane
headline.print_headline: Former Landfill, a Park to Be, Proves a Savior in the Hurricane
